newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - May 23.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - May 23.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:
* On Thursday, the Dow Jones industrial average closed down 32.56 points at 7,258.13 as investors mulled the Federal Reserve's decision to leave rates unchanged.

* Ousted Indonesian minority party leader Megawati Sukarnoputri said on Thursday she would not vote in general elections next week and told supporters not to cast their ballots for the party she previously led.
* On Wednesday, the Jakarta composite index rose 1.27 points to close at 654.09 points. The market was closed on Thursday due to a public holiday.
* On Friday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,443.00/44.00 at 0200 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,440.00/42.00.
* Bank Niaga, Lippo Bank and Semen Gresik after announcement of first quarter results.
* Small tourism services firm Bayu Buana on reports of possible financial restructuring.
* Small property firm Mas Murni on market talk of a possible take-over.
* Surya Dumai after the timber firm announced it had decided to change the use of part of its IPO proceeds.
